content.html:
Before
You
Begin

Adjusting Display Brightness


The brightness and hue of the viewfinder and LCD monitor can
be adjusted using the items in the 8 SCREEN SET-UP menu.
Choose EVF BRIGHTNESS or EVF COLOR to adjust viewfinder
brightness or hue, LCD BRIGHTNESS or LCD COLOR to do the
same for the LCD monitor.


1


Display Rotation


When ON is selected for C SCREEN SET-UP > AUTOROTATE
DISPLAYS, the indicators in the viewfinder and LCD monitor au-
tomatically rotate to match camera orientation.

Use 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING to choose from
the following display modes. You can choose separate display
modes for shooting and playback.


Choosing a Display Mode

OptionDescription
SENSOR EYE SENSORPutting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on.
EVF EVF ONLYViewfinder on, LCD monitor off.
�LCD LCD ONLYLCD monitor on, viewfinder off.
EVF EVF ONLY + SENSORPutting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD mon- itor remains off.
SENSOR EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP.Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting. The options selected for SCREEN SET-UP > IMAGE DISP. apply to display in the LCD monitor.
SHOOTING
14

# Adjusting Display Brightness

The brightness and hue of the viewfinder and LCD monitor can
be adjusted using the items in the 8 SCREEN SET-UP menu.
Choose EVF BRIGHTNESS or EVF COLOR to adjust viewfinder
brightness or hue, LCD BRIGHTNESS or LCD COLOR to do the
same for the LCD monitor.

# 1

# Display Rotation

When ON is selected for C SCREEN SET-UP > AUTOROTATE
DISPLAYS, the indicators in the viewfinder and LCD monitor au-
tomatically rotate to match camera orientation.

Use 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING to choose from
the following display modes. You can choose separate display
modes for shooting and playback.

Choosing a Display Mode

SHOOTING

| Option | Description |
| --- | --- |
| SENSOR EYE SENSOR | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on. |
| EVF EVF ONLY | Viewfinder on, LCD monitor off. |
| �LCD LCD ONLY | LCD monitor on, viewfinder off. |
| EVF EVF ONLY + SENSOR | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD mon- itor remains off. |
| SENSOR EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP. | Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting. The options selected for SCREEN SET-UP > IMAGE DISP. apply to display in the LCD monitor. |
